file_content.text: I've waited for you a long time.
Welcome to my home... "Outlander."
Jedi Master Satele Shan... I dreamed about meeting like this. Tell me it's really happening this time.
[Flirt] Please be real.
Whatever you believe this is, I'd rather not know.
Yes, I'm going to offer a meal. Stop rushing me.
You survived an ordeal. Come, sit. There's food.
Don't take this personally, but you've gotten... strange.
You were talking to yourself.
I think we both have.
Many things changed while you slept in carbonite. I led the fight to save the Republic from Zakuul. Nothing prepared me to face that enemy. I failed, again and again.
This camp isn't new. You've been on Odessen for a while.
When the Republic surrendered to Arcann, I gave myself to the will of the Force. I left the Core Worlds and found this planet. We've been here for years. Waiting.
"We?" Is there someone else here?
So you aren't alone.
In the Force, we are never alone.
We sensed your awakening on Zakuul. Felt the presence of our old enemy guiding you. We witnessed the victories and defeats leading you here.
When we found you in that clearing, we faced a choice. Bring you here... or end you there.
That's a little dark for a Jedi. I assume your training stopped you from killing me?
And you came to your senses.
We felt something we'd lost for a long time. Hope.
You've changed in ways you don't understand. Whatever his reasons, Valkorion has opened you to the power of the Force. And now we must train you to wield that gift.
Let me get this straight... I can move things with my mind, make people do anything I say, and shoot targets I can't see?
This changes everything.
That's one way of putting it.
I need to pop over to Nar Shaddaa. I'll be right back for my training--promise.
The possibilities are endless, but first we must learn focus.
Follow.
Jedi Master Satele Shan... When Valkorion told me to finish my training, he meant with you?
This is unexpected.
You're asking the wrong person.
You look like someone I used to know. Are you?
Refresh my memory about you.
You don't recognize your old teacher? Time isn't the only thing you lost on Zakuul.
Was it so long ago that we defended the Republic together as allies? Hmm.
I was once considered your Empire's greatest enemy. How things have changed.
Grand Master Satele Shan....
That was another life. It's just Satele, now.
I was brought here against my will. People are counting on me for help. I have to go.
I'm needed elsewhere.
People are always counting on you. They won't stop just because you aren't there.
Unless you're ready to stop hiding from the war, I'm not wasting my time with you.
We have nothing to discuss.
Not hungry? Fine. More for us.
You went underground to regroup--but how did you know I'd come here, too?
Waiting for me?
Our journey here wasn't about you. Not originally.
"The will of the Force?" You left the galaxy to be conquered by Arcann!
You coward!
Many confuse reaction for taking control. But there is power in stillness.
You're saying it was pure chance that you found me out there?
Our meeting was accidental?
Of course not. There are unseen influences working through me... Valkorion... and especially you.
You don't have the stomach to kill anyone.
You're too weak to kill me.
I can kill, when necessary. Today, it isn't.
Valkorion strengthened your connection to the Force. You may be the greatest of us all, now. You can't restore what we've lost, but you could build something to replace it.
Always wondered what it'd be like to have Jedi powers....
I'm gonna make a blaster that shoots lightsabers.
Well. That's going to take all the challenge out of my job.
I didn't ask for this "gift," and I'm not changing how I do things to join your club.
I don't want the Force.
We'll show you a path. You'll find your own way.
Maybe it's the way you keep calling yourself "we," but I don't feel comfortable taking pointers from you.
Sorry, but you're insane.
We understand, but we don't have a choice.
I don't think your son would appreciate it if you killed me.
Theron would not approve.
We didn't save you to spare Theron's feelings.
The only reason you're still alive is to satisfy my curiosity.
Don't test me, Jedi.
Valkorion strengthened your bond to the Force. You may be the greatest of us all, but your old training couldn't prepare you for what's to come.
You've changed in ways we still don't understand. Whatever his reasons, Valkorion has opened you to powers--and a destiny--far beyond the horizon of your old life.
You have much to learn. Follow us. Seek the answers throughout the valley. You will know when you find them.
